com.itworks.snamp.connectors.util

Class AbstractNotificationListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itworks.snamp.connectors.util.AbstractNotificationListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NotificationListener, java.util.EventListener

    public abstract class AbstractNotificationListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements NotificationListener
    Represents base implementation of the notification listener that simplify the lifecycle of listeners for the single management connector.

    The following example demonstrates how to use this class for organizing listeners:

    
      final AbstractNotificationListener listener = new AbstractNotificationListener<>("failures"){
        @Override
        public boolean handle(final Notification n){
          System.out.println("%s: SEVERITY: %s: CONTENT: %s" n.getTimeStamp(), n.getSeverity(), n.getContent().toString());
        }
      }
      listener.attachTo(connector);
      //some operations with connector
      listener.detachFrom(connector);

    This class is very useful for organizing unicast subscriptions.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Roman Sakno

      • getSubscriptionListId

        public final java.lang.String getSubscriptionListId()

      • getMetadata

        protected final NotificationMetadata getMetadata()
        Returns a metadata of the notification.
        Returns:
        The metadata of the notification; or null, if listener is not attached.

      • isAttached

        public final boolean isAttached()
        Determines whether this listener is attached to the management connector.
        Returns:
        true, if this listener is attached to the management connector; otherwise, false.

      • attachTo

        public final void attachTo(ManagementConnector connector)
        Attaches this listener to the specified management connector.
        Parameters:
        connector - The notification subscription provider. Cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This listener was previously attached to the management connector.

      • detachFrom

        public final void detachFrom(ManagementConnector connector)
        Detaches this listener from the specified management connector.
        Parameters:
        connector - The notification subscription provider. Cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This listener was not previously attached to the connector.

      • wrap

        public static final AbstractNotificationListener wrap(java.lang.String listId,
                                NotificationListener listener)
        Wraps a notification listener into the implementation of this class.
        Parameters:
        listId - An identifier of the subscription list.
        listener - A listener to wrap.
        Returns:
        A new instance of this class that wraps the specified listener.
